captions.text: - M-E-N-S-T-R-A-T-I-O-N?
No?
- I know an egg drops.

- I'm just imagining
a lot of, like, blood,

and like, stuff just kinda
just like floating around,

in all of these little
different cavities and stuff.
- Uterine walls of the uterus...

- (beep) me if I know
which one's the uterus.
- shed their lining.
- I'm assuming it's some up here,

and it's just like coated
in this nice stuff,

that's ready to hold a
baby, a potential baby.

- A woman's like, "Are we
going to get pregnant?"
And then it's like, "Nope!"

And then it's like, "Dang it,
why did we do all this stuff?"

- And it just sheds all the
lining, just sheds it out,
just shoots it out.

Sometimes there's pieces, most
of the time it's just blood.
- Um, I've never touched or seen
these things used in real life.

- So this is a pad, you
put it into your underwear
and then it catches your debris.
- I mean, I've seen the commercials,
where they pour the blue liquid.
- As you graduate from that,
and you want something less clunky,

you might want to consider
inserting something
up inside of you.
- What?

- I mean, I guess you
like stick these things
in your coochie, right?
- It looks like one of the party poppers
that people open.

- This cotton expands to
the size of your vagina.
- This is like modern technology, whoa!

- It soaks up the vaginal
fluid that comes out.
- This would be perfect for my nosebleeds
when I was a kid.
- There's three basic options,
only two of them are presented here.

- If you'd like to be more
caring for the environment,

you can stick a weird
cup inside of yourself
and catch it like a little drink.
- A pint.
- I'm going to say a pint?
- I would say, like, five ounces of blood.
That still seems like a lot,
because that's almost a pound of blood.
- Like half a cup.
- Is it a lot?
I would hope it's just a few drops.

Wait! How many times a
day does that happen?
It just keeps coming out?
Oh hell no!
- Is it because the egg is big?
- Little, like, clumps of stuff, like
go into these small holes.
- If you have flesh inside of you,
and it's just ripping itself off,
it's going to hurt!

- Cramps are caused by
the muscle contractions

that are forcing the
fluid out of the uterus.

- It'd be like when you're
at your friend's house,

and you like clog their
toilet, and you're like,
"What do I do? I don't wanna tell anyone,
"but I don't know how to fix this"

- I would think that an
organ is like popped?
- I'd bitch about it.

- I would probably do
exactly what women do.
I would go through my day,
pretending nothing was wrong with me,

despite the fact that
I'm in a lot of pain.
- I'd bitch about it all the time.
- I don't even know what I would do,
I'd probably have to, like, move away
from, like, all of my friends
because they'd probably, like, hate me.
- I'm sorry that it happens to you,
but, on the plus side,
if you want a baby,
someday, you get to make one.
And that's a whole new level of pain
you get to endure.

comments.author: crazymnky99

comments.text:
Ok yeah, but a really common misconception about periods is that your 
uterus is "excited" or preparing for a baby while in reality it is the 
exact opposite. A period actually creates a turbulent atmosphere to kill 
off weak eggs that may have survived otherwise, because really, the process 
of giving birth is really dangerous for women and babies so if we are to 
give birth we want to know the baby to survive and honestly your body 
doesn't even want babies. So don't think of it as a "temper tantrum" for 
not getting pregnant. Think of it as "OH HELL NAW IM NUKING THIS B*TCH"﻿

comments.author: Sarah Martowicz

comments.text:
some girls are lucky and have light periods that last 3 to 5 days.
I'm not one of the lucky ones. I have heavy periods that last anywhere 
between 2 weeks and 2 months.
I was once hospitalized after the 2 months one and given 2 pints of blood 
because I was anemic. I had to return two weeks later because the 
medication they gave me to stop my period failed after I finished it. I  
was given another 2 pints of blood. Birth Control pills were then given. 
They don't work 100% in keeping my periods in check but I want people to 
realize something. Birth control pills are not just for birth control. They 
keep me from bleeding to death by trying to stop the bleeding. 
Unfortunately because of their high prices I had to stop buying them. As a 
result, I have been on my period all month long...﻿

comments.text:
I remember almost dying in when I first got my period because I actually 
got it for 3 months and I didn't tell anyone because I thought it was 
normal (I was nine). Then I passed out one day and went to the doctors and 
because of all the blood loss I was anemic, had pneumonia, myalgia and the 
flu. :/ Periods can get serious people. ﻿

comments.text:
If I had the choice, but was still able to have children, I would not 
choose to have periods. I think they are disgusting. Natural, but 
disgusting. They're just a hassle which I find the biggest problem. OH, and 
the bloody price of sanitary towels/tampons. For all those commenting 
saying you get them at 14, well, it varies between each individual, but I 
was 9. Mine also last for 9 days, on a good month, sometimes 7... If I'm 
really bloody lucky.﻿

comments.author: brer4bear

comments.text:
Everyone always talks about how cramps are the worst part of a period, and 
sure, for many women it's agony. But I personally don't get cramps very 
often, and when I do they don't last very long. The worst part for me is 
feeling wet and uncomfortable 24/7. I feel like I can't move as freely as I 
normally do, and I'm constantly worried I'm gonna leak. It's just 
miserable. And no, not everyone can wear tampons. They're actually kind of 
painful for me.﻿
comments.author: PsychoticTragedy

comments.text:
The worst part is when I used to get it so bad I couldn't stand without 
passing out, and having people telling me to stop being a drama queen and 
suck it up. Men think it's all psychological and women who get mild cramps 
would tell me it doesn't hurt that bad, I'm just a baby.﻿
